characters.name: Mia Fey
characters.description1: Chief Attorney at Fey & Co.. My boss, and a very good defense attorney.
characters.description2: The victim. Chief attorney at Fey & Co. Law Offices, and an excellent defense lawyer.

characters.name: Maya Fey
characters.description1: Mia's little sister. Found bent over her sister's body, crying.
characters.description2: The defendant. Mia's little sister, and a spirit medium in training.
characters.description3: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.

characters.name: Dick Gumshoe
characters.description1: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.

characters.name: Miles Edgeworth
characters.description1: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.

characters.name: April May
characters.description1: An eye witness to the events. Testifies that she saw Maya commit the murder.
characters.description2: Stayed with someone else in the hotel on the night of the murder. Tapped Mia's phone.

characters.name: Marvin Grossberg
characters.description1: A veteran defense attorney, and Mia's mentor.

characters.name: Bellboy
characters.description2: Delivered room service to Miss May at the time of the murder. Also checked her in.

characters.name: Redd White
characters.description1: An eye witness. CEO of the information gathering company, Bluecorp.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.

evidences.name: The Thinker
evidences.description1: The murder weapon. Looks like a statue, but it's actually a clock. Made by Larry Butz.
evidences.description2: Clock in the form of a statue. The clock's gears have been removed. Made by Larry Butz.

evidences.name: Glass Shards
evidences.description1: The broken remains of a glass light stand. Broken beyond all recognition.

evidences.name: Receipt
evidences.description1: A department store receipt with letters written in blood on the back.
evidences.description2: Receipt for a glass light stand. The date of purchase is the day before the murder.

evidences.name: Maya's Memo
evidences.description1: "A conversation I had with my sister is recorded on my cell phone."

evidences.name: Mia's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Time of death: 9/5 at 9:00PM. Cause: single blunt force trauma. Death was instantaneous.
evidences.description2: Died from a blow by a blunt object. May have lived for a few minutes after being hit.

evidences.name: Maya's Cell Phone
evidences.description1: Holds a conversation between the Chief and Maya. Click here for details.

evidences.name: Wiretap
evidences.description1: Found in Miss May's hotel room.

evidences.name: Floor Plans
evidences.obtained: Submitted as evidence during the trial.
evidences.description1: The murder scene, the Fey & Co. Law Offices. Click here for details.

evidences.name: May Testimony
evidences.description1: "The victim dodged an attack then ran to the right, but she was caught and struck."

evidences.name: Photograph
evidences.description1: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" are written in pencil.

evidences.name: Photograph
evidences.description1: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit B" are written in pencil.

evidences.name: Bellboy's Affidavit
evidences.description1: Describes the man who stayed with Miss May in the hotel on the night of the murder.

evidences.name: Newspaper Clipping
evidences.description1: Article about politician's suicide. The word "White" is written in pen at the top.

evidences.name: Mia's Memo
evidences.description1: A list of people's names in Mia's handwriting.
